page.title: 11GEORGIAN FARMHOUSE
page.content: The house was built when king George was on the throne. It was at least 170 years old you could tell that Georgian by the shape of the windows and the fanlight above the door and the tiles where very old.It was named after an elm tree across the road but it was chopped down due to Dutch elm disease. Unlike Georgian town houses which have three stories the house only has two stories. The house has been kept in the family ever since it was built above the door was a brick with J.R.M inscribed on its, the initials of the builder. The house was a farm house which has probably started in the industril Revolvtion to feed the growing town of Derby. It still provides milk and meat for Derby in 1985
